title.narrative: Personalbidrag till Osses civila observatörsinsats i Ukraina, OSCE SMM Ukraina
Personnel to the OSCE Special Monitoring Mission to Ukraine, OSCE SMM

description.narrative: Aktiviteten saknar beskrivning. Kontakta Sida för mer information. Ring +46 8 698 50 00 eller skicka e-post till sida@sida.se.

The Swedish Police Authority has been assigned by the government, through the ordinance on police peace support (1999:1155) and yearly regulation letters, to recruit and make personnel available for international civilian crisis management and peace support operations under the auspices of the United Nations (UN), the European Union (EU), the Organisation for Security and Cooperation i Europe (OSCE) or similar organisations. The OSCE Special monitoring mission to Ukraine (OSCE SMM) is one of the operations to which the Swedish Police Authority contributes with personnel.
Polismyndighetens personal ska bidra till genomförandet av insatsens uppdrag.
That the Swedish Police personnel contributes to fulfill the mission's mandate.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During 2021, a total of 4 Swedish Police employees were seconded to the mission, this corresponded to 2,3 annual work units. During 2020, a total of 4 Swedish Police employees were seconded to the mission, corresponding to 2,5 annual work units. During 2019, a total of 12 Swedish Police employees were seconded to the mission, corresponding to 10,1 annual work units. During 2018, an average of 7 to 8 Swedish Police employees (a total of 14 individuals) were simultaneously seconded to the mission. During 2017, between 3 and 9 Swedish Police Officers were seconded to the mission. During 2016, between 8 and 12 Swedish Police Officers were seconded to the mission. During 2015, between 3 and 8 Swedish Police Officers were seconded to the mission.

Under 2021 tjänstgjorde totalt 4 svenska polisanställda (3 kvinnor och 1 man) i insatsen under hela eller del av året, vilket motsvarade 2,3 årsarbetskrafter. År 2020 tjänstgjorde 4 svenska polisanställda (2 kvinnor och 2 män) i insatsen under hela eller del av året, motsvarande 2,5 årsarbetskrafter. År 2019, tjänstgjorde 12 svenska polisanställda (7 kvinnor och 5 män) i insatsen under hela eller del av året, motsvarande 10,1 årsarbetskrafter. År 2018, tjänstgjorde i snitt 7-8 svenska polisanställda samtidigt i insatsen (totalt 14 individer). År 2017, tjänstgjorde mellan 3 och 9 svenska polisanställda i insatsen. År 2016, tjänstgjorde mellan 8 och 12 svenska polisanställda i insatsen. År 2015, tjänstgjorde mellan 3 och 8 svenska polisanställda i insatsen.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
